Content.Name: As BBC World Service
Content.Description: BBC Radio 4 joins the BBC World Service for a selection of news and current affairs, arts and science programmes

Content.Description: The latest national and international news from BBC Radio 4

Content.Description: National and international news from BBC Radio 4

Content.Description: Charles Leadbetter presents a series on sleep

Content.Description: Full coverage and analysis of the day's news

Content.Name: The Archers
Content.Description: Jolene won't accept defeat

Content.Name: Cooking for Michael Collins

Content.Name: Any Questions?
Content.Description: Jonathan Dimbleby chairs the discussion as an audience in Tonbridge in Kent puts questions on the issues of the week to a panel of four leading figures

Content.Name: A Point of View
Content.Description: David Cannadine presents a weekly reflection on a topical issue

Content.Name: The Friday Play
Content.Description: Wouldn't It Be Better If He Died in the End? By Laurence Allan

Content.Description: Analysis of the day's national and international stories, including interviews with politicians and public figures, with Robin Lustig

Content.Name: Book at Bedtime

Content.Name: Copysnatchers
Content.Description: David Aaronovitch with the topical chat show in which guests from around the world observe, parody and dissect current British stories from a foreign perspective

Content.Name: Today in Parliament
Content.Description: A review of the day's events in Parliament, with Mark D'Arcy

Content.Name: From Our Own Correspondent
Content.Description: Insight, colour, wit and analysis as the BBC's foreign correspondents take a closer look at the stories in their regions

Content.Name: Prayer for the Day
Content.Description: Daily prayer and reflection, with the Rev Ruth Patterson

Content.Name: Hidden Treasures

Content.Description: The latest news from BBC Radio 4

Content.Name: Open Country
Content.Description: From the Shetland Islands to the Channel Islands, from Ireland to East Anglia, Open Country explores Britain's rural life

Content.Description: Miriam O'Reilly presents this week's countryside and agricultural news, with comment from Radio 4's experts

Content.Name: Today
Content.Description: With Edward Stourton and James Naughtie

Content.Name: Home Truths
Content.Description: David Stafford takes a wry look at the foibles of family life, with Radio 4's very own dirty linen basket

Content.Name: Excess Baggage
Content.Description: Sandi Toksvig opens her Excess Baggage, full of the best travellers' tales, anecdotes and stories from around the globe

Content.Name: The Eureka Years
Content.Description: Adam Hart-Davis explores spectacular years in the history of science

Content.Name: The Week in Westminster
Content.Description: Peter Riddell takes a look behind the scenes at Westminster

Content.Description: Jonathan Dimbleby takes listeners' calls in response to today's edition of Any Questions? To air your views call 08700 100 444 [national rates]

Content.Description: Being Mussolini, by Boothby Graffoe

Content.Description: Maria Friedman recently made her Broadway debut in Lloyd-Webber's new version of The Woman in White

Content.Description: Highlights of the week's Woman's Hour programmes, presented by Martha Kearney

Content.Name: Profile

Content.Description: Tom Sutcliffe and guests review the week's cultural events

Content.Description: Peter Snow hosts the quiz which tests the teams' general knowledge and risk-taking skills

Content.Description: Roger McGough features listeners' requests for haunting poetry, including Alfred Noyes' The Highwayman, Edgar Allan Poe's The Raven and Walter de la Mare's The Listeners

Content.Description: Nicholas Parsons chairs as guests try to speak for 60 seconds on a theme without hesitation, repetition or deviation

Content.Description: A chance to hear the peal of the bells from the church of St

Content.Name: Radio9
Content.Description: In a world where presentation is at the wheel and content is bound and gagged in the back, Radio9 finds itself with much to say, but no idea how to say it
